alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 16 at 1:52AM CDT until April 16 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HASKELL...NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH...SEQUOYAH... SOUTHWESTERN ADAIR...NORTH CENTRAL LE FLORE...SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE AND MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 151 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Taft to 5 miles south of Webbers Falls to 2 miles west of Marble City to 7 miles northeast of Keota, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Sallisaw... Fort Gibson... Muldrow... Checotah... Roland... Spiro... Warner... Vian... Panama... Gore... Webbers Falls... Oktaha... Gans... Marble City... Braggs... Taft... Boynton... Tamaha... Council Hill... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 265 and 324. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Haskell; Le Flore; McIntosh; Muskogee; Sequoyah
